*p**location_mentioned*New York*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="09-27-1834">Sep. 27th 1834*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Dr Sir*/p*
*p*I have endeavored some time ago to inform you not only of my claim but of the measures which I caused to be taken in your behalf, the moment I learned that you was detained a *person_mentioned*prisoner */person_mentioned*in *location_mentioned*Mexico*/location_mentioned*— I lost no time in procuring from *person_mentioned*our Governt */person_mentioned*(through my *person_mentioned*Brother in Law Forsyth (now Secretary of State)*/person_mentioned* and my friend *person_mentioned*M McLean*/person_mentioned*, then Secy.) the immediate interferance thereof in your behalf.*/p*
*p*I trust that it has been useful to you*/p*.
*p*I hope to hear from you with little delay—I wish you well and shall be happy in every honorable way to do you good.*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*H Meigs*/person_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Colonel Stephen Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*[Addressed;] *person_mentioned*Colonel Stephen Austin*/person_mentioned* of *location_mentioned*Texas*/location_mentioned**/p*
